msItem.title: Lives of Saints and Martyrs

msItem.title: The history of Pelagia, the harlot, of Antioch

msItem.note: See the Acta Sanctt. for October, t. iv., p. 262.

msItem.title: The history of Eupraxia

msItem.author: John of Asia
msItem.title: The history of the two sisters Mary and Euphemia
msItem.rubric: ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܕܐܣܝܐ. ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܬܪ̈ܬܝܢ ܐܚ̈ܘܬܐ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܬܐ. ܕܡ̇ܬܩܪ̈ܝܢ ܗ̈ܘܝ ܒ̈ܢܬ ܛܒܝܐ. ܘܚܕܐ ܦܘܠܚܢܗ̇ ܒܐܡܕ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܗܘܐ. ܘܚܕܐ ܒܬܠܐ ܕܡܘܙܠܬ.
msItem.note: See Add. 14,647, fol. 40 a, and Land, Anecdota Syr., t, ii., p. 92.

msItem.author: Athanasius
msItem.title: Letter of Athanasius to the Virgins, who went and prayed at Jerusalem, and returned
msItem.rubric: $ܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܬܢܣܝܘܣ ܪܝܫ ܐܦܝܣܩ̈ܦܐ ܕܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ (sic) ܕܠܘܬ ܒܬܘ̈ܠܬܐ ܕܐܙ̈ܠܝ ܗ̈ܘܝ ܨ̈ܠܝ ܒܐܘܪܫܠܡ ܘܦ̣ܢ̈ܝ

msItem.title: The history of the virgin Susanna

msItem.title: The history of John of Rome

msItem.title: The martyrdom of Sabinianus
msItem.rubric: ܗܘ ܦܡܢܡܛܐ: (sic) ܕܡܪ (sic) ܣܒܝܢܝܢܘܣ ܣܗܕܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܚܝܠܐ
msItem.incipit: ܫܘܪܝܐ ܕܡܡܠܠܗ ܕܣܗܕܐ܇ ܕܐܣܗܕ ܒܙܒܢܐ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܒܣ̇ܘܣ ܕܘܟܣ܇ ܘܕܡ̣ܛܪܝܘܣ ܗܓܡܘܢܐ. ܒܪܝܫ ܫܘܐ̈ܠܘܗܝ ܕܒܣ̇ܘܣ ܕܘܟܣ̣. ܐܡ̣ܪ ܠܗ ܠܣܒ̇ܝܢܝܢܘܣ. ܣܒ̈ܝܢܝܢܐ̣. ܠܡܢܐ ܩ̇ܝܡܬ ܠܘܩܒܠ ܡ̈ܠܟܐ܇ ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.title: The martyrdom of Seleucus and Stratonice
msItem.rubric: ܣܗܕܘܬܐ ܕܐܣܛܪܛܘܢܝܩܐ ܘܕܣܠܘܩܘܣ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ (sic) $ ܡܟܝܪܗ̇. ܒܩܘܙܩܘܣ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܒܡܕܒܪܢܘܬܗ ܕܢܡܪܝܢܘܣ ܡܠܟܐ ܚܢܦܐ ܘܪܫܝܥܐ ܕܘܟܪܢܗ ܠܠܘܛܬܐ

msItem.title: Discourses by several writers

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Discourses of Jacob of Batnae

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On the Creed of the Council of Nicaea
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܡܪܝܥܩܘܒ ܕܥܠ ܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܣܢܗܕܘܣ ܕܐܬܟܢܫܬ ܒܢܩܝܐ ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܘܣ ܡܠܟܐ
msItem.incipit: ܒܗܝܡܢܘܬܗ ܕܒܪ ܐܠܗܐ ܢܗܪܘ ܒܪ̈ܝܬܐ. ܘܒܗ ܐܬ݀ܦܬܚ ܥܠܡܐ ܣܡܝܐ ܘܚ̣ܙܐ ܢܘܗܪܐ

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On the Creed of the Council of Chalcedon
msItem.rubric: ܐܚܪܝܢܐ ܕܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܕܥܠ ܣܗܢܕܘܣ ܕܟܠܩܢܪܘܣ
msItem.incipit: ܓܢܒܪ ܥ̈ܠܡܐ ܕܒܝܕ ܬܘܩܦܗ ܦ̣ܪܩ ܒܪ̈ܝܬܗ. ܦܪܘܩܝܗ̇ ܠܥܕܬܟ ܡܢ ܫܘܥܒܕܐ ܕܟܦܪ̈ܝ ܒܫܡܟ.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: On Pentecost
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 328, no. 184.

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Discourse of Ephraim on the Prophet Elijah and the Widow of Zarephath
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܣܡ (sic) ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܥܠ ܡܪܝ ܐܠܝܐ ܟܕ ܫܕܪܗ ܡܪܢ ܠܨܪܦܬ ܨܝܪܢ (sic) ܨܝܪ (sic) ܐܪܡܡܠܬܐ (sic) . ܡܛܠ ܕܟܦܢ.
msItem.incipit: ܥܒ̣ܕܐ ܕܪܚ̇ܡ ܠܗ ܡܪܗ. ܥܠ ܟܠ ܕܐܝܬ ܠܗ ܡ̇ܫܠܛ ܠܗ. ܐܢ ܕܝܢ ܓܕܫܐ ܘܣ̇ܢܐ ܠܗ. ܡܢ ܟܠ ܕܐܝܬ ܠܗ ܓ̇ܠܙ ܠܗ. ܏ܘܫ.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Discourse of Jacob of Batnae on Pride
msItem.rubric: (sic) ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܕܡܪܬܝܢܘܐ: ܕܥܠ ܚܬܝܪܘܬܐ ܫܘܒܚܐ
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 316, no. 86.

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Discourse of Ephraim on the Female Sinner
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܣܝܡ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܕܥܠ ܚܛܝܬܐ ܕܐܬܟܪܗܬ ܒܚܛܝܬܐ.
msItem.incipit: ܫܡܥܘ ܘܐܬܠܒܒܘ ܚܒ̈ܝܒܝ. ܕܟܡܐ ܡܪܚܡܢ ܐܠܗܐ. ܠܚ̇ܛܝܬܐ ܫܒ̣ܩ ܠܗ̇ ܚ̈ܘܒܝܗ̇. ܐܦ ܣܡܟܗ̇ ܕܡ̇ܥܩܐ ܗܘܬ. ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: Compare Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 156, no. 54.

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Discourse of Jacob of Batnae on the Ten Virgins
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 322, no. 139

msItem.author: Isaac of Antioch
msItem.title: Funeral discourse of Isaac of Antioch on priests and deacons
msItem.rubric: ܕܥܠ ܩܫ̈ܝܫܐ ܘܡܫܡ̈ܫܢܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܝܣܚܩ ܥܠ ܥܢܝ̈ܕܐ
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 233, no. 95.

item.p: Vellum, 8 1/4 in. by 5 1/8, consisting of 217 leaves. The quires, signed with letters, are 21 in number. A single leaf is wanting after fol. 171. There are from 19 to 26 lines in each page. This volume, which is palimpsest throughout (see below), is written in a good, regular hand, and dated A. Gr. 1161, A.D. 850.
On fol. 214 a, after the doxology, there is an Index of the contents of the volume.
A note on fol. 214 b informs us that the manuscript was written in the year 1161, A.D. 850, and that it belonged to the priest Job and another man, whose name is not mentioned

p.quote: ܫܠܡܬ ܕܝܢ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܒܫܢܬ ܐ̈ܠܦܐ ܘܡ̈ܐܐ ܘܫ̈ܬܝܢ ܘܚܕܐ ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ. ܒܢܝܣܢ ܝܪܚܐ. ܒܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܘܠܬܐ (sic) $ܒܗ. ܝܘܡ ܐܪ̈ܒܥܐ. ܕܐܝܬ ܒܗ̇ ܬܫܥ̈ܝܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܢܫ̈ܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܬܐ ܘܥܠ ܐܢܫܐ ܡ̈ܝܬܪܐ ܘܐܝܬ ܒܗ̇ ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܡܠܩ̈ܛܐ. ܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܕܝܢ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܐܝܘܒ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܕܟܬܒܗ̇ ܗ̣ܘ ܘܐܢܫ ܐܚܪܝܢ ܐܟܣܢܝܐ. ܐܝܟ ܕܢܐܬܪ ܡܢܗ̇. ܘܟܠܢܫ ܕܦ̇ܓܥ ܒܗ̇. ܏ܘܫ.

item.p: On fol. 1 a there is a note, in the usual form, stating that this was one of the 250 volumes brought to the convent of S. Mary Deipara by the abbat Moses of Nisibis, A. Gt. 1243, A.D. 932.

As mentioned above, this manuscript is palimpsest throughout. The ancient text is that of a manuscript of the Gospels, according to the Peshitta version, written in a fine, large Estrangela of the vith or viith cent. The quires are signed with letters; e. g. foll. 31 a, ܓ, 181 a, ܒ. The Ammonian sections and Eusebian canons are marked on the margins, e. g. foll. 5 a, 48 a, 143 a, 182 b ; and there was a harmony at the foot of each page, e. g. foll. 48 a, 88 a, 92 b, 151 a. There were also rubrics indicating lessons for various occasions, e. g. foll. 3 a, 6 b, 66 a, 143 a. Most of these things, however, being written with red paint, have either nearly or altogether disappeared. Fol. 112 b exhibits a Cross within an oval nimbus, which was probably once decorated with various colours. There is a similar Cross, but of smaller size, on fol. 216 a.

revisionDesc.change: This MS is a palimpsest that needs special encoding.
